name: Richard Rumley
text: Experienced, knowledgeable, and friendly staff. Good strict adherence to Covid-19 policies. Have been a patient here for 3 years and feel comfortable with the great level of medical service and care I have received.

name: Danita Coleman
text: Been there 3 times. Dr. and staff is Great.. Dr. will sit and Listen to you while u talk about your complaint..

name: Chris Vaughan
text: Short wait for appointment. Staff very friendly and nurses are top shelf good. Dr Vaughan is friendly, courteous, and very knowledgeable. He take up whatever time you need, answers any questions you ask, and is refreshingly candid. Could not ask a more pleasant experience.

name: Merna Hostetler
text:
Thought it was a good place when Dr. Vaughn was still there and the wait has never been that long I like how convenient it is.

Lately I call up there to get refills on prescriptions and somehow it doesn't seem to get past the front desk.

name: Larry Herr
text: Always a pleasant staff and the service is Top Notch. Doctor Vaughan is the best one I've had in my 72 years.

name: gabby no
text: Takes forever, terrible staff and doctors, will not give an answer as to what is wrong with and send you off with some prescription for medicine even without knowledge as to what is wrong. It’s worth it to drive somewhere else where you can actually get care. Deserves less than one star.

name: roro C
text: I've been there twice and once I thought it crowded. I like the convince to me

name: Anne Chambless
text: Good drs nice nurses

name: Childs H. Turnage
text: Love it.

name: Brendashotcaller Kirkland
text: Good Dr.

name: Mark Mach
text: I wrote a negative review and it only shows up when I am signed in under that username. I created this username, signed on and my negative review is nowhere to be found. Google is not showing negative reviews for this surgery center. I think people searching for information here should be able to get ALL the info, not just selected "good reviews." Withholding negative reviews by former patients is equal to telling lies.

name: Art Gribensk
text: Good folks

name: Bill Jordan
text: Dr. Duffy has taken care of my family's vision for many years, and done a superb job.  He is not only an outstanding physician, but a remarkably nice person.  As genuine as they come.   I recommend him wholeheartedly to my friends, and those who choose to see him come away with exactly the same opinion.   I am grateful to him for his caring, thoroughly professional approach, that has permitted me to continue seeing with a clarity that I would otherwise not have known.  I was reluctant to deal surgically with cataracts,  until Dr. Duffy called my home and discussed the procedure at length, and assured me it was safe.  Afterwards, I could see more clearly, remarkably so, thanks to his personal care, and genuine concern.  He is a fine doctor.

name: Travis Pettaway
text: I seen dr Jackson for new glasses... he got my prescription wrong 2 times. He told the clerk those are the glass he want me to have even though I can’t see with them. Then dealing with eyeglass manager Melissa they had me try the glasses on several times like they were suppose to get better . She offered me a full refund of 261.70 in which no one seem to know anything about when I called patient accounts. I called VSP they said that Premiere Medical can simply do the refund over the the phone without paper work. Premier Medical is dragging their feet with my refund. They care nothing about customer satisfaction and I’m done with them.you been WARNED😡

name: Aleah Licht
text: These people are the best ever. I called to make my appointment at 3:15. My appointment was for 4. I got there by 3:30 and left by 4:14, tearing up because I'm not used to actually being listened to and taken care of so well!

name: Elizabeth Wittmann
text: My 5 year old had her tonsils and adenoids removed on monday... Her dr told me the week before he would send her home with something for pain, just in case.. Well guess what!? My baby has been in pain for 2 days because obviously her dr lied!

name: marvin stewart
text: I had an appointment with Dr. Michael Lee recently. the staff was very friendly. I was called back very quickly. And Dr Lee was very thorough. I was very pleased with my visit, and will definitely recommend my friends and family to this office.

name: Michael Staden
text: We are here for my mothers 6 month checkup on her eyes and the staff are so easy to work with and Dr Duffey is awesome. I have to drive her from Milton to Mobile but for the care...it’s all worth it.

name: Jade Sullivan
text: We had a wonderful experience at the Premier Medical East Office.  Everyone was so kind and patient.  Our ENT was very thorough and personable.  Would highly recommend this group!

name: Tiffany Carter
text: If I could give no star I would this place is horrible and all about the money. I took my daughter in base off a referral from her pediatrician because of her eye was irritated badly to the point she was holding it and it was swollen. Just because of a minor one call  insurance error with my daughter PCP these ppl wouldn’t see her. When I told them I’m just go to the ER they had the audacity to send the RN out to tell my 3 YEAR OLD we will take care of you as soon as mom pay the $150 fee or get a referral with our previous army doctor in Fort Stewart. I’m just let this sink in cause I’m done with this place. This is horrible service as a person who is also in the medical field. This deed and comment is disgraceful as hell never had I send a place that would treat a in pain pt without getting a payment. Most place with see the pt right way and take care of it later but this place with not get a penny from me or my insurance. I’ll travel to Baldwin county or Pensacola Navy base before I see them again.

name: Richard Britton
text: They always have time for me and keep me hearing good.  they have a group of smart people that know what to do to help you hear better.

name: Michael Jenkins
text: Dr. Sullivan operated on my throat and I can't say enough about how confident He made me feel from our first appointment.  Now, four days after my surgery I am healing nicely and the pain I experienced was nowhere near what I had expected.   I highly recommend Dr. Sullivan,  his team, and the wonderful staff at Springhill Medical Center.

name: Haley Ladnier
text: I wanted to specifically praise Dr. Sullivan based on my last visit. He's very friendly and addressed my problem after listening to my concerns. Professional and personable, would recommend.

name: Jacob S.
text: The most efficient and compassoinate medical staff I have ever experienced.

name: Lesa Moore
text: We love this entire group - used Dr. Bryars for 17 years and now Dr. Sullivan. Would highly recommend them. Dr. Sullivan is great and so is his wonderful staff.

name: Marion DuBose
text: I love coming to this office the staff is very friendly and helpful and you are in and out quickly plus Dr King is so friendly and efficient and professionals

name: Walter Roney
text: My experience was extremely satisfying from every aspect. Dr, Sullivan was thorough and informative comparing my present conditions to those that existed at the time of my last exam.He was, if you will excuse the pun, the patient one.

name: James Shifflett
text: If I could give 0 stars I would! My son (15mo) had his first appointment with Dr. Wilson recently and it was terrible! He has had chronic ear infections so which my pediatrician believes was delaying his speech. His appointment was at 9:05... I got there at 8:40 to fill out paperwork and was not called back until 11:44!!!! Then when we saw the Dr. it was for less than a minute, had to go back to the waiting room, get a pressure test, then go back to the waiting room to wait to hear the results. Finally when we got back there the Dr. said all looked fine... Duh, he just finished his second round of antibiotics, and we were told to come back when he had an infection to take another look. He didn't want to address any of my concerns about speech ect. Finally left the office around 12 something. I called to switch doctors because I heard Sullivan was great. They would not let me!!! Now I'm off to find another practice. Ridiculous!!

name: Charlotte Farmer
text: Had not been there in a very long time. Was pleased with the efficiency of the appt.

name: Meredith Brannon
text: They took great care of my little girl...the procedure was quick and even called a couple of days later to check on her ☺️

name: VANESSA PUGA
text: Worst experience ever! From before my surgery and after. I had a tonsillectomy done with Dr. Lee but the problem was with his very unhelpful staff. I had to fax my FMLA forms 4 times for the office to fill out and send back since the nurse claimed ”there was no where for the doctor to sign”  each time I sent the forms was with a cover letter requesting a call back when it was sent since the fax machine was not mine. I was NEVER called back and had the same nurse catch a attitude when I called up there to check. After Finally getting the forms back(btw it was the same forms I sent the FIRST time so it wasn’t necessary for me to send it FOUR TIMES she just didn’t look hard enough) I see I was only given exactly 1 week to be back at work. Now I spoke to the doctor before even scheduling this surgery and I advised him that I work at a call center so I’m on the phone literately all day and he told me normal recovery time would be 7-10 days and due to my job I would probably need more time so getting those FMLA forms with only 1 week was pretty upsetting. I call the office back and speak with nurse Jessica the same nurse who “wasn’t getting my faxes” and she tells me there is no follow up appointment after surgery and that only one week is permitted(completely different from which the DOCTOR told me) and with a smart tone says “even small children are given this time.” Well EVERYONE knows that for children to heal is a lot quicker than adults for this kind of stuff plus I am a19 yr old with a full time busy job as I explain to the nurse she says and again with and attitude  “your voice will be perfectly fine” I haven’t had the surgery yet but she definitely knew that. The day of the surgery my appointment was at 9 and didn’t get called back until 2 hours later. Post surgery I wasn’t given any paperwork or info as to what will be happening to me over the next few weeks. Let’s just say day 6-11 I woke up crying from the pain. I was not able to even speak or swallow anything until about 2 weeks after not to mention the jaw and ear pain I had still after that and the worst part was after I ran out of my prescribed meds I called the nurse to see what I can take and she told me ibuprofen was okay I tried it over the weekend and called again Monday since i was not feeling better and was told by a different nurse THAT I SHOULDN’T be taking ibuprofen since it increased my chances of bleeding. All in all I was lied to and disrespected MULTIPLE times NEVER AGAIN WILL I VISIT THIS OFFICE.

name: Erin Killion-Cowart
text: We love Dr. Sullivan! He is great with our kids and the staff at Premier Medical is amazing !

name: DeLynn Joyner
text: Dr. Sullivan was very thorough & helpful to me when I had not been able to get a diagnosis from any other doctor I had been over months.

name: Amy Pettway
text: I was processed in quickly. Dr King was untrusted and addressed all of my concerns and questions

name: Kara Howard
text: Was called back for surgery 1 1/2 hours after I was scheduled, but everything else was fine.

name: Blast The Word!
text:
The wait time wasn't long at all, and the staff was friendly and knowledgeable.... I trust Premier Medical with my health care needs, and would definitely recommend them to others.
A. Robinson

name: Annie McRee
text: Dr Sullivan is very informative & caring. He will now be my go-to for all ENT issues!

name: Rejs Avlis
text: Yesterda I went to see a Dr. The lady at the front desk ask me for SS  and DOB and email, she gave me a sticky pad to write info. I don’t know if that is normal but I felt really discomfort giving to her all that personal info.on sticky pad and  She never returned it to me.

name: Joe Sirmon
text: 5 Star on all accounts.  Dr., nurse, receptionist and cashier.

name: Kori J
text: My feel-better-quick go to place!

name: Heavenly Xpressionz
text: My daughter had an appointment at 9a this morning and here it is 11a and we're still sitting here and haven't been seen yet.

name: al ramsey
text: exelent service

name: Kim Snyder
text:
This review is for the office; I would actually give them 0 stars. Trying to set up my first appointment took months because they will not allow you to make an appointment without a referral from another doctor, which is ridiculous. Then, in trying to change an appointment today, I have now been on hold for over 45 minutes (at this point, I really want to see how long it will take; I'm invested!). I'm sorry, there is no excuse for this unprofessional behavior. My time is just as important as theirs. Why can't medical offices find competent business staff? I really hope they figure this out.

For Dr. Bolton, I would give 5 stars. He is knowledgeable and takes the time to review insulin pump and CGM reports to help patients utilize these technologies to the fullest to improve. Being a type 1 himself, he understands the struggles we live with on a daily basis, which can't be taught in med school.

name: David Sweet
text:
These are some of the rudest people l have ever encountered. You cannot get anywhere with anyone in person, or on the phone. They like to hide behind the phone so they can continue to be rude and then put you on hold for so long in hopes that you will hang up.

I understand there is construction going on, but why would you allow them to park their machinery or put their supplies in the handicap spots. Handicap parking is already limited, especially van accessible spots.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Sweet, we would like to discuss this matter further. Will you please call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak with the operations manager so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. All the best, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Abigail Laird
text: I've had constant pain for years now and because I'm young the doctors feel "uncomfortable" trying more serious treatments even though I'm losing my whole life to this pain. For over 2 years I have had to wait 1 to 2 months for my doctors appointments and every appointment they tell me the same thing and go in circles with me, refusing to progress treatment. On top of that when they reply to reviews they copy and paste the same message over and over again. They are not listening to me and they won't listen to you. They don't care.

name: V White
text: At first doctor was nice the first few visits. Then the doctor started to act like he did want to be bothered. Came in leaned against the cabinet acting like I was a waste of his time. Yesterday stated he didn’t keep track of my health that I saw specialist for that let them keep track of my seizures and heart. He was only there for general things. But yet he is required by law and my insurance to keep track of who I see and my medical records. To which he demanded I find another doctor all because my disability lawyer asked if he could give his opinion on a form since he was to be talking with all doctors he referred me to. The billing and customer service department of the group believe that I got what I deserve and the doctor is correct. I am a person that has seizures and has AFib and has not been driving since a wreck to where this is the second general practitioner has refused to listen as a doctor should. And force me to find another doctor and the cost of losing everything because of they don’t care.

resp.text: We would like to discuss this matter further, so we encourage you to call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak with the operations manager so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. All the best, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

text:
The doctors are very thorough! The nurses, lab techs, and the entire staff are very professional, helpful, friendly.
The Follow my Health app that the doctor office use is very helpful to me. I can keep up with all of my lab results and be made aware of any changes in minutes.
I would highly recommend A.M.G.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and the 5-star review. Our healthcare team takes great pride in creating an environment where patients receive quality, individualized and compassionate medical care. Thanks again for the feedback!

name: Miss Shauntay
text: If you have a bill you can’t even make an appointment. They are going to constantly push that bill in your face. Not only that Dr. Carlos doesn’t care about his patients. More than once he’s come in seen me for 2 minutes and dumped me out. I didn’t feel that I had answers or anything. He just gets his money and doesn’t care. He doesn’t take your symptoms serious. Over a year ago I saw him about symptoms he told me I just needed to lose weight. Long story short I nearly died because of a appendicitis. He doesn’t investigate anything. He writes prescriptions and referrals wrong also. They will get your money for sure! But care is below average. Nurses are nice and fast though

resp.text: We would like to discuss this matter further, so we encourage you to call our office at 414-5900 so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. All the best, and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Sarah S
text: If you want to waste your time using this Dr's office then this is the place for you! I have NEVER in my life dealt with a medical office with such poor service. Whenever you call this office to leave very important information concerning your health, asking for a NURSE to call you, be prepared to wait days (thats even if you get a return phone call) The Dr seemed like a very concerned physician however his nurses like to treat patients like their the Doctor! I had one nurse who called me back after 4 days and she tried to tell me she knew exactly what the Doctor had ordered me to do with a certain medication and when i ask her how she knew, she tried to tell me she was in the room with the Dr. which I called her out on because she wasnt in the room with the dr and I. A lady by the name of Jordan was, this ladies name was Gloria! When I confronted her and told her NO MA'AM you were not in the room Jordan the dr and myself were the only 3 people in there that day, she put le on hold and later came back to the phone with a different attitude, but informed me that my Dr was out of town and guess what HE HAD NO FILL INS.. I have worked in the medical field and bo that Drs cant just leave their patients without ANYONE to help them with their medical needs!! Long story short I went without my medication from Thursday until the following Thursday! 7 FULL DAYS!! It was no big deal to this lady at all!! I have gladly found another physician and I honestly wouldn't take my animals to this office!! So again if you want to deal with getting the run around THIS IS YOUR PLACE, IF NOT DONT BOTHER EVEN MAKING AN APPOINTMENT!! I will be reporting this medical office!! Thanks for wasting my time Alabama Medical Group!! Maybe dr Rubenstein needs to stick with being the mayor and retire at being a physician!!!

resp.text: Hi Sarah,we value our patients greatly and ask you and all of our patients to feel free to provide feedback about our services. We really would like to discuss this matter further so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. Would you mind speaking with our operations manager about your experience?

name: Janet Newburn
text:
I don’t normally write online reviews, but this group is terrible.  The Doctor’s and staff are nice, but lack professionalism. I see Rubinstein at the Saraland location and Siegel at the Springhill location.
The wait times are off the charts. When you ask why you are waiting so long, they either just look at you or push you to another waiting area. My time is just as important as theirs. I was at the Saraland location today for over 2 hours. I saw Rubinstein for approx. 4 minutes. Routine checkup.
The staff has not the first clue about what’s going on medically with patients.  I have been called with incorrect information regarding my results, I have had to tell them what they were supposed to be doing per visit with Doctors.  I have been scheduled for a procedure that was ill prepared then I was forgotten.
Office Managers, are you reading these reviews?
Patient care should come first and far most at all times.  The staff in these offices should be more concerned with this than what they are having for lunch.
I walked out after seeing Rubinstein today after I was left sitting to have blood drawn. (I know how long it takes to draw blood)
I’m sure they couldn’t care less! Sooner or later this junk is going to catch up with y’all.

name: Howard Rhodes
text: They wouldn't call in my blood pressure medication while I was out of town, And had much attitude about it !  So I had to find a new doctor.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Rhodes, value our patients greatly and ask you and all of our patients to feel free to provide feedback about our services. We really would like to discuss this matter further so that we can help resolve any issues that may be. Would you mind speaking with our operations manager about your experience?

name: Becky Kidd
text: I am so very thankful to Dr. Jonathan Siegel and his wonderful staff. Each person was extremely helpful, professional, and caring to me, from the initial consultation with Dr. Siegel, to follow up after my procedure.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Ms. Kidd. We're glad to have Dr. Siegel as a member of our team and are so glad you shared your feedback with us.

name: SHANTA EDWARDS
text:
This is the worst group in the Bay Area PERIOD!! I was turned away because I couldn't pay $110 on a previous bill that didn't even belong to the Dr I was seeing! I made arrangements on this bill and have been paying monthly but this DR refused to see me still!! All the money that I've paid and my insurance have paid and this is how I'm treated!!! I'm not asking for special treatment, just trying to be treated!

I am in severe pain and I am ashamed for this group that they would care more about money than they would helping care for their patient! What kind of medical practice does this!!!!! Only money hungry ones. I will NEVER come back to this establishment nor will I recommend them to anyone. I am going to share this story on social media as well, to let people see how these practices are letting patients suffer because of the almighty green dollar. It is not right nor is it fair. I could see if I had NEVER paid them anything, but to pay every month even with me not even working, makes this situation not only sad but despicable and down right disheartening.  Thanks so much Alabama Medical Group and your doctor's for always putting money first over patients!!!!!!!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Ms. Edwards, on behalf of Alabama Medical Group I apologize that you feel this way. I've spoken with the customer service rep who assisted you today and I have reviewed your file and there seems to be some inaccuracy's with your statement that I'm hoping we can clarify. If you will please call our office at 414-5900, our operations manager would like to discuss your visit in further detail. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Kacey Young
text: Waited two hours for my mother to see a doctor for a scheduled appointment. Then the front desk was very rude. Never apologized for the two hour wait. They are overbooked. Shouldn’t have to wait all day for appointment.

resp.text: Hi Ms. Young, we're sorry to hear that your mother's appointment ran late, but unfortunately due to the nature of our business sometimes this happens. If you would like to discuss this matter further or if we can reschedule your mothers appointment, please call 414-5900 and ask to speak with our operations manager and she will get her scheduled.

name: R.Allen Crowe
text: So I just retired from the United States Navy after 28 years of service.  My family and I moved to Mobile, Alabama for our last move as we intend to live here for the rest of our lives.  Well as in any place you live there are many good things and there are not so good things that you experience.  We just came across a not so good thing and that is the Alabama Medical Group, P.C.  We were only with this PCM and the medical group for 3 or 4 months when we received in the mail a letter from them dismissing one of my family members.  The letter did not state any reason why only that they “need to do this from time to time.”  When asked why our family member was dismissed their representative would not provide a reason and on top of that they were rude during our phone conversation.  As a Navy Captain (retired) who has been to many places in this world along with my family who have been with me through all of that,  this has been the most disappointing experience of my career and was upsetting for my family members.  As a result of this,  my entire family has now changed PCMs.  I hope this feedback will help the management of Alabama Medical Group to self reflect and make some changes for the better. In the meantime,  I would not recommend this facility if you are a veteran as I assume they do not hold the veteran status as important.  That is strictly my impression.

resp.text: Capt. Crowe, I've looked into the situation involving your wife's experience at our practice and due to HIPAA compliance regulations there is very little I can comment about her visit and post publicly on the internet. It's unfortunate to hear that she had a negative experience, and I would like to encourage her to call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak to the operations manager or the marketing director so we can discuss the allegations in your comments above. One comment that I can, and would like to address, is your statement saying that we do not support veterans. That simply is not true. In fact, several of our physicians currently serve in the military, along with members of our staff, as well as their spouses. We appreciate their service to our country along with yours and the other men and women who chose to make that sacrifice to protect and serve our great nation.

name: Trevor Clifton
text: I may be partial, but Alabama Medical Group is the best practice in Mobile! I will definitely continue to use my physician and the organization for any needs that they are able to assist with.

resp.text: Trevor, we don't think you are being partial at all. We appreciate your 5-star review and positive comments!

name: June Reddix-Stennis
text: Just left the Alabama Medical Clinic Walk In Clinic, I was refused service first because it was 4:15pm but the Facebook page says the close at 5pm and the website says they close at 4:30pm, either way I got there at 4:15pm so she said they couldn’t see me because they cut off at 4:15! Then she asked if my primary doctor was in the group, my response was no but I have two specialist in the group, so she then informed me that they couldn’t see me because I didn’t have a primary doctor there. The website says nothing about having to already have a primary there! Either she was lying or the website is giving out bad information! I just drove all the way from west Mobile to go to the walk in clinic and couldn’t even walk in! Wow! I’m sooo disappointed, someone really needs to correct this problem, it’s so unprofessional and so was she! My visits with my specialists there have been great but the Walk in Clinic needs work!

name: Laurie Watson McKay
text: My surgeon was Dr. Scott. He was fantastic and very down to earth. I would trust him to cut me open anytime! :-)

name: Jennifer Schuller
text: Internal Medicine Center is made up of a group of kind, caring and compassionate physicians who are highly skilled and trained to take care of all of your healthcare needs.

resp.text: Thank you for the 5-star review and the positive feedback. We are so pleased to hear such kind words about our staff.

name: Robert Johnson
text: i like Dr Carlos and think he's a good dr but I wish the waiting time wasn't always so long to see him.

name: Frances Moore
text: I found that the Doctors at the center are helpful but the staff are horrible.  They are not concerned with the patients health.  They are not helpful and when you are sick you want to be able to see the doctor.  I was told that I could go to their urgent care facility the next morning if I was having a problem.  Horrible staff I would not recommend this facility to a dog.

name: Bo Lambert
text: Best doctor...Dr Arnold....nice to know some one cares when you go in...and oh by the way..WDE..DOC!!!

name: Neal Hattenstein
text: Dr Alan Shaine is my Doctor and he is a womdeeful doctor sits with you and exam .just great bed side mannnee

name: tammy beard
text: The facility itself may be ok. Idk. But , in my opinion, Dr. Amy Strasburg is rude, vapid, unprofessional and would be better suited for a career behind a cosmetics counter. If you go there, ask for a different doctor. And be prepared for each and every visit to take two or three hours. Apparently, their system completely collapses on a regular basis.

name: Rebekah Graham
text: Everyone is friendly and Dr. Hayden Long is the best.

resp.text: Thanks Rebekah, we are so glad to have Dr. Long as a member of the AMG team!

name: Daniel Crocetti
text: Great team of professionals, providing excellent care.

name: Mohamad Sahyouni
text: Horrible.

resp.text: Hi Mr. Sahyouni, we're sorry to hear that you had an unpleasant experience at our practice and would like to discuss the details of your experience. Would you mind if our operations manager contacted you to discuss?

name: Gina Huie
text: We can not seem to get much information about our mother, who was sent to this facility from UAB on 4/9. They shipped her over just days after she almost bled to death while performing a simple procedure to remove a halo from her right leg/ankle. She needed 12 pints of blood because Dr. Johnson nicked an artery while putting a chest tube in. She's had a tracheotomy tube in since then also! I would like to believe that her trachea has healed by now! I've requested a summary of admission for my mother and for a physician to just call me, but I'm still waiting!  Prior to her accident , I was her primary caregiver for her appointments and cancer treatments. The pandemic has been tough for everyone, but my mother especially! Also, this company is not Brookwood Hospital. They're just renting space there!

name: Emma Smith
text: Great experience with Dr.Smith. I have fought strep throat 3-4 times a year for as long as I can remember. Last ent I saw said "we'll just do an allergy test." $200 later and not even a step of progress. Smith didn't beat around the bush and asked me if I was comfortable having surgery. Now I'm recovering from a tonsillectomy and in absolute misery but know in the long run this is the best thing I could have done. Great staff, great doctor, great experience.

name: Brian Dothan
text: What a relief! I finally found a doctor that cares. I highly recommend ENTCare and Dr. Chelsey Smith. I love the staff and how methodical Dr. Smith was during my visit. Surgery was a great success and I can now sleep and breath better. I recommend ENTCare over any other ENT office.

name: Carli Sontag
text: I can not say enough good things about Dr. Chelsey Smith! The best patient care!

name: Pauline Heffernan
text: Dr Stringer is great. Excellent communicator and listener!

name: Koechera Washam
text: Be prepared to wait over 3 hours

name: Elise Lang
text:
The contact lens department at Premier Medical in Mobile, Al is terrible. They make the customer feel as if you are inconveniencing them by being there.  Jessica White really doesn't like to be bothered to have to get up out of her chair to help the customer. The tone in which she speaks to the customer solidifies her position that you are just a bother in her day.
I have never had a problem with any other area of Premier Medical or any of the doctors. Someone is asleep at their job to allow this extremely poor customer service to be happening at a professional office.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Overall a great experience on first appt to evaluate for cataract surgery. Dr. Charles Mostellar was very personable, patient, thorough, and inspired confidence. His nurse Nicole, staff member Devon, and others were excellent. Coffee while you wait to warm you, bc it's pretty frosty in there. The front reception was a bit chaotic. Also, a counter that is not ADA compliant, but they were nice and professional, not asking you to holler your SSN so others can hear, but letting you write it down and then giving you back the piece of paper. Nice facility except a tight, neglected restroom. Parking inadequate, but they were great about creative solutions. Morale here seems high and support staff training seems priority, and that goes a long way. I have no qualms letting Dr. M operate on my family member.

name: Carlos Javier Noda
text: Went for an eye exam was treated poorly by desk staff will not return. Recommend you go somewhere else.

name: Debbie Honodel
text: I have always been greeted by friendly, helpful staff. I have seen both Dr. Charles Mosteller and Dr. Spires over the years. Both are professional, skilled doctors with great staff.

name: Carolyn WHITMAN
text:
Excellent service from check in to the wait time. Dr.,Walton and his nurse were very efficient and caring. I was diagnosed quickly and was home (from Orange Beach,Al) in less than 2 hours. I will recommend Premier Medical without hesitation.  Thx for your service - first class!!
-

name: Louis Mayfield
text: I personally have had 3 visits to this facility in the past few weeks. All have been good experiences for me. Staff is always friendly and helpful. Appointment times are fairly prompt, physicians are courteous and not in a rush geta headcount. I highly recommend this business.

name: Barbara Barber
text: Helpful staff from the time you make an appointment until you check out. It is easy to schedule an appointment at a convent time. Staff is willing to answer your questions about procedures and treatments. The doctors are professional, knowledgeable and through in their treatment.

name: Latino Bonnie
text:
I read a one-star review posted three years ago about a new patient waiting three hours to be seen. Perhaps that problem has been corrected. It certainly wasn’t true for me at Springhill West in Mobile, AL., where  I had my initial appointment at 1:50 pm on 3/5/2020. I arrived 20 minutes early to fill out paperwork as a new patient of Dr. Alfred Neumann. I had just finished completing my paperwork when I was called from the lobby waiting room on the first floor for my appointment. I also had a five-star experience with Dr. Neumann and his entire staff. They too were prompt in each segment of my visit. I highly recommend PMG at Springhill West AND Dr Alfred Neumann and his medical and office staff. Their is good energy in their offices, professional and warm.

Potential patients from Atmore, AL might like  to know it was exactly one hour from my home on Laurel Street to Premier Medical Group’s Springhill West location. Parking is on the near side of the building as you enter from the service road, parallel to Springhill Avenue.

Bonnie Latino

name: Jonathan T Geary
text: Dr. Elliot is a great doctor who is very concerned about you. She is one of the few doctors who will sit and talk and answer all of your questions. Her nurses are also very polite and caring also.

name: Helen Nixon
text: The wonderful and caring staff here at Premier Medical have been a life saver for me. As a nurse I depend upon my vision to help me take care of My patients, everything from reading a heart monitor, mixing drugs and starting IV lines.  I developed double vision in one eye related to Graves disease  (15 yr after radiation treatment for the Graves) that required a prism and surgery. Dr Terry and his staff were wonderful, they explained everything and calmed our fears. The surgery went well and i am seeing fine again!

name: Priscilla Sullivan
text: In my 28 years I have never been more disappointed. This doctor office only cares about your money and not the patients. My daughter is scheduled for tubes and if it wasn't something we needed to do immediately I would ask for recommendations to another doctor. "Marion" who makes what I can only assume collection calls needs a bit more training on customer services and collection calls. Actually she probably should be taken off calls all together because she is the main reason all of my family members will no longer use this doctors office. She is blatantly rude and down right ugly. You would think when one person is spending over $1400 out of their own pocket you would treat them a little bit better but I guess not. She started her "collection" calls 4 days before the payment was even due. The list of complaints of her are ridiculous.

name: James Kirksey
text: In the past 40+ years of receiving care from 4 or 5 doctors at Premier Medical Group, I have never been disappointed.  I like your method of sending patients to the specialist and sub-specialist, who are best in their field for specific medical conditions.  Your Medical Technitians are well trained and do a yoeman's job of tests and procedures.  You offer the best for eye care.

name: Darlene Smith
text: Dr. Salisbury and his staff were absolutely amazing.  My visits included surgery.  I could not be more satisfied from the point of diagnosis to follow up appointments.

name: Jen Sims
text: First visit was good. Second visit, my ear was still in alot of pain again and they took my money and I was told nothing was wrong with it. Well, thats great and all but now I am stuck with head aches and severe ear pain and I am searching for another doctor.

name: Tonya DUPREE
text: The office called me regarding a referral for my daughter for Dr. Swain.  I was at work so I had to call back.  When I called back they advised they had no referral and that no one called me.  I told them I dialed the number back out of my recent calls and asked if Dr. Swain was indeed a provider there.  They said yes but we dont have a referral and we didn't call you but we will make the appointment but when you get here she wont be seen.  SHE WAS SO RUDE!!!! Then she went on to say if we were a no show I would be charged.  ALL NEGATIVE FROM THE MIN MY CALL STARTED!!  I have been in customer service management in the medical profession for 20 years and I can tell you this was terrible!!  Needless to say we are being referred elsewhere!  My daughter needs a tonsillectomy but a doctor that allows his staff to treat his patients that way will NOT do surgery on my daughter.   And to post a review you have to choose at least one star but this place doesn't even deserve that!!!!!

name: AnnC
text: The staff is always very courteous and efficient. I’ve been seeing Dr. Harrison for years and he’s the Best!!

name: J. D. Powell
text:
I currently use two doctors at Premier Medical West. Dr. James Pitcock and Dr. Chris Walton.  I have used Dr. Pitcock for nose and ear issues now for several years.  He is always in a good mood and very friendly. If I am in for my ears he will also check out my nose and throat for any possible issues I might not be aware of.  I'll continue with him until he retires.
Dr. Walton - I have seen for little over a year.  He did my cataract surgery in both eyes. I was going to go for some lens that Medicare would not cover and was willing to pay the additional cost.  Due to some eye surgery over 30 years ago he recommended against the more expensive lens.  I appreciate that. He too is friendly and very pleasant to talk to. I picked him because of his specialty and his age because I wanted to stay with one eye doctor until my end on this earth. I'm staying with him.

name: Staples Wood
text: Dr. Walton helped me with my eyes, Dr. Harrison helped me with my ears, then Ms. Jessica Robinson helped me with my bill. A wonderful and caring group of professionals!!!

name: shawne mcgraw

Stop over booking! Hourly employees lose a lot of money waiting 3 hours. Will never go back and have told others to avoid. Get it together!

name: Alarider USA

Premier Medical

name: Heather Chandler
text: I called and ask if they could finish a test I had had two weeks ago or if it had to be the original facility I was told they could and the woman insisted on a price check after I told her I had not been there and had no insurance. The price was $10 which was $10 cheaper than the other 2 doctors offices I had called. The reason I was not able to go to the original doc that did the test was because they closed at 5 I knew I would not have made it from Boaz to Guntersville before 5 but I could have made it to the other doctors office in Albertville that would have charged me $20. When I walk in I told the girl I called and she said you haven't been here before right and I said right I was handed paperwork only to be told 5mins to 5 after I walked in at 440 that it would be a $65 charge bc I had to see the Dr & 10 for the test. At that point I didn't have a choice but to pay the amount because the other 2 had closed and he test I needed would have expired today and I couldn't start over. So you can imagine there was a back and forth fast forward to the picture below that is the room I was left in. The paper wasn't changed and there are dirty tissues on the counter. If I pay the 65 for the visit I better get a clean room I was just fed up at that point. Won't return ever.

text: Had appointments and have to set there at least 45 min after my appointment been waiting on a sleep study for 2 months and still  have not gotten scheduled

text: Last minute visit bc of a gym workout “kink”. I was in and out in 30 minutes and felt 100% better the next day. I felt right at home even though I was a new patient @ 7:30pm on a Friday night. Great staff and really clean environment. They have separate area for well and sick visits- for those concerned with Covid patients being mixed in with the well areas, like myself. Could’t get through on the phone after about 10 attempts but other than that it was a pleasant experience and friendly staff.

text: This place is telling anyone who test positive to quarantine for 10 days and they are tracking you to make sure your at home.

text:
This is the absolute worse doctor you could go to. I went to this doctor, they gave me a shot and took a X-ray and charged my insurance. Without notice they reported me owing them almost $300 to a collection agency that went against my credit. I’m still trying to get it removed.
I went to a different doctor and had the exact same thing done on purpose and that doctor charged my insurance and all I had to pay was a $30 copay.
I believe this United Doctors is a rip off of a money ring charging the insurance company and you too.. Also, if you are not a Mexican prepare to be treated very different

text: If they call you you better answer right then cause you will play a game phone tag for the next few days trying to find out what they wanted or if you are trying to inform them of something.

name: michelle ryder
text: The worst place ever. The staff is so incompetent and unkind, you leave there wondering who and why would anyone hire such a group of inept people!  If you are sick, you won’t get any better if you go here for help. Dr. Gaspar spent 2 whole minutes with me after waiting almost an hour and I had an appt. He is one of those doctors who is just in it for the money. The staff does not introduce themselves nor explain what they are doing. They barely even look at you and never smile. I will Never go back there. They don’t even offer you a receipt; I had to ask for it. I had to ask about lab results; they weren’t even going to tell me that. All they want is your money.

name: LYNNE THOMAS
text: Friendly staff.  Fast and thorough with questions!  Dr Enrico Gaspar was Great!  Followed up with tests and Referrals right the next day!  Medication was waiting at my pharmacy when I got there!  I have found my new Primary Doctor and a wonderful staff!

name: Janice Warpool
text: I found myself a wonderful place to see my doctor a nice staff.  They care.

name: Samantha Shumaker
text: What a terrible day I am having because of this place. I went here because I am sick I waited 40 min in the waiting room for them to tell me that there was a balance on my account, from bloodwork that I had to get done when I was hired to work as a caregiver and that job never paid the bill. Instead of calling where I used to work to have them pay for it because they were supposed to pay for it, the receptionist expected me to pay for it and wouldn't see me unless the bill was paid. I never received a statement saying I owed anything and I am sick and frustrated and will need to go somewhere else now and waste more time.

name: Briana Powchak
text: Was really hoping Inhad found a new doctor.  Moved to the area recently.  Went in and was diagnosed with strep.  Was given antibiotics and sent home.  Twenty four hours later throat is very sore, still have the fever and now a pounding headache to boot.  Receptionist said the antibiotics don’t start to work until 24 hours.  Not my experience the last 5 times I have had strep, but if theyre too busy, I can go elsewhere.

name: Nancy McDougal-Skinner
text: I called this morning and asked if I could bring my son here for a 4-h physical and for the blue slip, I was told yes, and I asked what time they close and that was the end of the conversation. Then, I get here at 5:30, because I work and that's the earliest we could get here. I was informed that I would need to make an appointment, because the doctor wasn't here, and I asked why couldn't the nurse practitioner do this, since it clearly states that it needs to be signed by a doctor OR nurse practitioner, and I was told because they couldn't even give me a blue slip without an appointment. 1. Why when I called this morning was this not mentioned, and 2. Why can't a nurse practitioner sign where it says nurse Practitioner, are they not confident in their nurses ability. Is this somewhere I really want to start bringing my family. Then, to top it off. They agreed they could do it, then was kinda rude, (btw, we weren't signed in, so there was no knowledge of insurance or how we paid) and was like, oh btw, this isn't covered by Medicaid and I explained that I do have a job, and I can pay for his appointment. She then looked at me and said, well, it is 25$! Don't look down your nose at people and assume they are poor, and unable to cover Drs appointments. I am in my work clothes. I don't feel very welcomed here.

name: Taryn Horton
text: They take the time to sit and speak with you. There's not a double booking of appointments like at the last place I went, Miranda and Dr T and Dr clifton are awesome. If you need it, they will help you. I'm so happy I've changed myself and my kids dr to them.

name: Lori Diamond
text: A great doctors office.  Also have a speedy wait time for walk-ins

name: Alicia Coots
text: Not the nicest people in the world, but I like that I can walk in & see a Dr. instead of being sick & not being able to get an appointment for weeks.

name: bobbie gomez
text: Got in got out

name: Margaret Smith
text: The staff is super nice

name: Robert Sherrell
text: Got in quick with out appointment

name: Derek Hackney
text: The folks here are wonderful.

name: yvonne richey
text: Feels like you are family. From front desk, to staff and Doctors in back...

name: kristi gibbons
text: The ONLY reason this rating isn't a 5+ is the wait time. The staff are all wonderful and Dr Green makes you feel as if you are the only patient in the world. He is an excellent diagnostician and a great communicator...he always makes certain that you understand what's going on without "talking down" to you. We have also met with Chris and Hallie on occasion and they are both very thorough, competent, and compassionate. So, even though the wait time seems excessive, Dr Green and his well chosen staff make it worth the wait.

resp.text: Wow - we really appreciate your kind and thoughtful words.  When it comes to our patients' health, we think that a visit simply takes however long it takes.  We abhor the idea of asking our patients to "come back next week" just to address the fourth, fifth, and sixth items on their list of concerns simply because they wouldn't fit into the 15-minute slot that the doctor was willing to provide; ultimately, that delays care and often leads to the patient spending more time overall at the office - not to mention the extra copayment. At the same time, we loathe waiting too, and we are focused on reducing the "however long it takes" part of visits, WITHOUT sacrificing the quality and detail of service - because quality MUST come before efficiency. The healthcare system that most primary care practices must operate in today doesn't promote high-quality care; one reason is that providing detailed care takes more time than it should.  It's time that the systems were designed from scratch.  Stay tuned.

name: Michelle Creacy
text: Out initial visit was excellent! My husband and I both saw Hallie, the PA. She was very thorough and knowledgeable. After 2 years of seeing a DO, who never once checked out heart rate and lungs,  it was a relief when that was one of the first things she checked... finding a slight heart murmur and an extra beat in my heart rhythm, she did an EKG in the office and after consulting with Dr. Green, scheduled me for an Echo. I am thankful and we are looking forward to developing a long term relationship with Green Primary Care.

resp.text: We appreciate the time you took to share the details of your experience!  (And Hallie appreciates that you spelled her name correctly!) The model of collaborative practice between PA and MD is intended to work just precisely as you described.  Long-term relationships with our patients are the primary joy of what we do, and we welcome patients who seek the same.  Thanks again for your comments.

name: Stephanie McLaughlin
text: I am not an established patient at Green Primary Care, but I attended a public COVID-19 vaccination clinic that they held at their office. The receptionist (Ashley) at the front desk was very polite, professional, and welcoming. The wait was minimal, the nurse that administered the injection was professional, efficient, and skilled. I haven't met Dr. Green, but the office staff was great!

resp.text: We appreciate the time you took to write down your impressions, Stephanie!

name: Sandra Wayrynen
text: Always nervous with new doctor appointments but this was absolutely a positive experience for me. The staff was professional and pleasant, efficient and respectful. The NP I saw was attentive, nonjudgmental, informative and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this group as a Primary Care Group.

resp.text: We are ecstatic to read that you had such a pleasing experience!  We strive to surprise those who aren't traditionally comfortable in a doctor's office.   Chris has a wealth of experience and his demeanor puts people at ease.  Thank you for your message.

name: jerrval legette
text: Everyone was nice and friendly. Excellent place for primary care. And they really care about there patients. 10 out of 10

resp.text: We are really happy to hear this!  We do care about our patients, and are glad to know when they feel it.  Thanks for taking the time to let us know.

name: Michael Pace
text: Dr Green, and his entire staff, are the most professional staff I have ever experienced in my 59 years. They also could not be any nicer, no matter how far you you searched. They deserve 5 stars, and more. I am very happy I was referred to Dr Green to be my primary care doctor.

resp.text: Thank you for your gracious feedback, Mr. Pace!

name: Patti Moss
text: Dr. Green and his staff are a caring group. They take time to listen and are thorough in explanations. Both my husband and I are happy that we chose Dr. Tyler Green as our primary care physician.

resp.text: Your kind remarks mean a lot to us, Mrs. Moss!  We appreciate that you took the time to leave them.

name: Robert Loncaric
text: The visit with Doctor Green was very pleasant and I felt confident that he is going to figure out was has been ailing me.  The wait in the outer room was longer than i expected.

resp.text: Mr. Loncaric - We appreciate your kind words.  It's very important to us that our patients receive thoughtful advice, regardless of how long that may require.  At times that doesn't take long, and with  simple things, time is of the essence.  Yet, our patients often come see us for concerns that aren't so simple.  Our philosophy in our system is that speed can accompany quality (as with simple things), and quality can come before speed (which is often necessary for things that aren't so simple), but speed can never come before quality of the hierarchy of priorities.  Thanks again for your feedback!

name: Carolyn Cunningham
text: I like Dr. Green because his knowledge is current and he doesn't rush through your appointment to go on to the next one. Even though I don't see him often,  he is familiar with me and my health issues. The ONLY drawback is the wait. I always schedule for a first appointment of the day to avoid the longest wait times. that occur with later appointments.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, Ms. Cunningham!  We believe quality must always come before speed, and are continuously working on improving both.  We also have faster options depending on the type of care our patients need.

name: Chris Truman
text: I had a great experience with the practice the staff ate all courteous and professional i would recomed this office to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your experience, Mr. Truman!

name: MorphitIRL
text: Dr Tyler Green is my favorite Dr I've ever had. His staff is friendly and so is he. He is the first Dr I've ever had come and see me at the hospital to make sure I'm ok. He actually listens to you and makes incredible notes on everything he does and has you tested for. I'm very happy I have him as my primary Dr He is also a Dr that isn't going to just toss you prescriptions to make you happy. I don't want a Dr who will give me a drug habit. He is not one of those type of people and that is a major thing I look for. I also enjoy Mary. I've know her for a long time from my previous Dr. She is very nice and helpful as well. I highly recommend Green Primary Care for healthcare.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

name: Trish Brown
text: I love all the office staff they’re so nice and my Nurse Practioner Chriss is very attentive to my needs and has a great personality that makes it so easy to discuss all my medical concerns with him.  I always refer any of my friends to them when they’re  looking  for a great family practitioner.

resp.text: Thank you, Trish!  Chris has a broad clinical background that he combines very effectively with an easygoing manner and impressive efficiency, which makes him a very skilled clinician.  We are lucky to have him as a part of the family taking care of our patients.

name: Marquita Duckett
text: Nice clean office, friendly staff, wait time was very minimal and the doctor was down to earth and cares about his patients.

resp.text: Thank you very much, Ms. Duckett!

name: f king
text:
Dr Green has a great medical staff, very friendly and helpful.

I feel very comfortable with Dr Green, Dr Green takes the time to explain every thing with me.
His demeanor really puts me at ease, I feel I can ask as many questions as I want.
I would highly recommend
Dr Green!

resp.text: Our approach is to make shared decisions along with our patients, rather than to force uninformed decisions on them, and we find it's much better when patients are engaged in understanding their health along with us. Thank you for taking the time to share your experience, Ms. King!!

name: jeptha tuten
text: This was my second visit to this office. I enjoy the effeciency displayed by the entire staff with little waste of my personal time. The individual attention to my health concerns are taken seriously. I have enjoyed my experience at this facility.

resp.text: It's very gratifying to hear that your experience has been efficient, attentive, and enjoyable!  Those are three of our key objectives.  We will keep working hard to offer the best primary care experience possible.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know.

name: Melissa Evans
text: Dr. Green listens to my concerns and gives sound researched medical advice.  He has great beside manners and cares for my health journey.  I would, and have recommended him.

resp.text: Your kind feedback really means a lot to us, Ms. Evans.  Thank you for sharing it.  Here's to a smooth health journey for everyone in 2021!

name: Tom Jones
text: Pleasant and professional staff.  Dr. Green is respectful, knowledgeable and professional.

resp.text: Thanks very much for the encouraging feedback, Tom!

name: Melissa Strickland
text: Dr. Green is respectful and thorough in diagnosing health problems whenever I have to visit him. Takes detailed notes. I trust Dr. Green and his staff, especially Mary. I think highly enough of them to have referred a close family member to their practice.

resp.text: We appreciate your endorsement and your encouraging words, Ms. Strickland!

name: Anonymous
text: Very welcoming and caring doctors office. Always willing to be there for you in times of need and I feel very confident in Dr. Green & his staff to care for myself and my family.  Very up to date office and easily accessible patient portal so I can communicate with the staff and doctors about my medications and any other questions I may have. Thank you for everything you do. My family and I love being a part of the family atmosphere of your office.

resp.text: Thank you very, very much for your kind words!

name: Margaret Turner
text: Prompt, courteous, and friendly staff. Doctor was thorough in examination and sincerely interested in finding out my health issues along with follow up.

resp.text: We sincerely appreciate your uplifting feedback!

name: Dave Wilburn
text: Dr Green and Chris O’Barr have taken care of me  and I’m very pleased with both. The staff is friendly and caring.

resp.text: We really appreciate the kind words, Mr. Wilburn.  Happy New Year!

name: Anthony Spencer
text: Fast and friendly staff! In and out, not a lot of waiting I noticed that on the first visit!

resp.text: Thank you, Mr. Spencer!  Quality medical care takes time, but we are working on getting faster all the time.

name: Dee Nelson
text: Dr. Green really listens to his patients and works with them to make the best care plan!!!

resp.text: All of our staff really enjoy sharing the journey with our patients.  We appreciate your kind feedback!

name: Scott Moss
text:
We are new patients, we had a good experience with the Nurse Practitioner (Chris), we've not met Dr. Green yet. We just had physicals and don't have to see a doctor very often thankfully. I will say their EMR system is just so-so. Even after almost a month, our labs did not post to our account. They did send them in private messages but I feel it would be helpful if your medical records and tests were easily accessible.

In my experience, I generally never have issues with medical professionals, it is the support people that usually cause difficulty (office and billing).

My recommendations, post lab results promptly to the patient account. It would have been nice for our first visit to have been with Dr. Green.

resp.text: Mr. Moss - Thank you for the kind words about Chris - we consider it a privilege to take care of our patients.  We share your feelings about the labs.  Just to clarify, in most cases, as in your case, we review our patient's lab results as quickly as we can, almost always within a couple of days of our receipt of the data.  Then, if the patient requests that we we do so (and not every patient desires that we do), we will share the results on the portal, where they can be seen by the patient directly.  Exactly how the results are displayed on the portal, however, depends upon how the lab sends us the results.  If the lab provides results to us in a structured, computer-friendly format (which we prefer), they will appear in the "lab" section; on the other hand, if we receive them via fax, we will forward those pages to the patient in PDF format, which can be viewed on the portal as well, in the "messages" section.  We agree it would be much better if every lab provided their results in structured format, but not all lab vendors are doing that just yet.  We are working hard with our lab vendors to make that a reality, and have been for some time.  We expect that in the very near future, virtually all of our patients' results, including labs drawn here at the office, will be received in a structured way (and, in turn, passed along to the patient that way).  We would like to make things as easy and intuitive as possible, and we agree that would help.  Also, if you would like to see Dr. Green, just give us a call and we will be happy to move up your follow-up appointment sometime sooner.  Thanks again for giving us a chance to take care of you.

name: Debby Griffith
text: Friendly, efficient staff; clean and comfortable office environment.

resp.text: Thanks for your encouraging words, Ms. Griffith!

name: Debbie Hansen
text: We recently moved her and chose Green Primary Care. We like Dr Green and really don’t want to to go through the hassle of finding a new doctor so soon. But only having come twice now, we both are considering a new office. In each of two visits a piece we have waited for over an hour before even seeing him. My husband left a msg for him and he, nor a nurse never returned the call. What if it had been an emergency?

resp.text: Ms. Hansen, thanks for the kind words about our doctor.  We understand the frustration of waiting for someone.  Suffice it to say that this spring and summer have certainly been trying seasons for us all, in healthcare and in other areas of life, and our continuing efforts to perfect the patient experience haven't yet consistently manifested in shorter wait times for patients.  Some day soon, they will.  We give each of our patients all of the time they need, and we can only hope that you and your husband have felt that.  We strive to get the right care to the right patient at the right time, and for that reason we have two other providers in our practice at present, an NP and a PA.  They are both quite skilled at treating complex patients, but they naturally tend to see patients for visits that are less complex on average than those handled exclusively by the doctor, and so for some patients there are many times that they may offer a more efficient healthcare encounter.  Consider visiting one of them in the future, and we believe you will find it to be a pleasant experience that you may even prefer.  Every patient will be seen by the doctor periodically as well, and the doctor is always available when necessary.  With respect to the question regarding a return call, we wouldn't want to discuss the specifics of a particular patient's situation in a public forum; however, if there were an urgent matter, we would ask that in the regrettable event that you don't hear back from us promptly, that you simply reach out to us again to check on the status of the issue and to reiterate the urgency of the matter; if there were to be a medical emergency, we would recommend that you seek care at a hospital emergency department and call an ambulance if necessary.  We thank you for giving us the opportunity to care for you and your husband, and we hope to see you again soon.

name: Jeffry Schumerth
text: Like my service their and d the way I was treated

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Schumerth for the kind words! We enjoy having you as a patient!

name: William Boglio
text: Doctor and associates are friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Mr.Boglio!

name: William Boglio
text: Doctor and associates are friendly and helpful.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Mr.Boglio!

name: Vincent Shumber
text: Dr Green and his office personnel are considerate, courteous and professional. They are the epitome of medical service.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind words, Mr. Shumber!

name: Carol Drake
text: Dr. Green is awesome!    So glad he is my primary physician!!!!

resp.text: We sure appreciate the kind words, Mrs. Drake!

name: Barry Rogers 9
text: In and out with blood draw by Honey Didn't hurt and got a coffee to go.

resp.text: We hear that about Honey Kate's phlebotomy skills quite frequently!  Thanks for the nice feedback, Mr. Rogers.

name: Jen Carpenter
text: Dr. Green is a young, modern doctor!! He has an excellent staff and is updating the office equipment to support your health needs (become paperless!!)  and ensure that each patient is knowledgeable about their health. He is  exceptionally patient, taking time to carefully review my medical history and discuss with me, my health plans for the future. My daughter also has seen Dr. Green and she also had the same experience, he spent well over 45 minutes with each of us on our 'new patient' appointments. Excellent care delivered here.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, Jen!

name: Mark Clark
text: I am sure that Doctor Green is very capable and he seems friendly.   But this office has no regard for the patients' time.  You will wait here for very long times, even the first appointment of the day.   They automatically charge double  for physicals that are covered 100% by insurance.

resp.text: Mark, thanks for the feedback.  We believe you bring up an important point that we would like to highlight.  It’s true that patients sometimes have a wait to see their doctor or practitioner, and we take no pleasure in it when a patient is upset.  We would respectfully disagree, though, that this is due to a lack of regard for our patients’ time.  In fact, we see it as quite the opposite.  We take our time with our patients.  Most patients have many questions, each of which deserves respect, and we strive to consider each one thoroughly at the time it is asked, rather than asking the patient to arbitrarily pick just one or two and return for yet another appointment at another time to handle the rest, which would delay care for weeks or months and require another trip to the office (and possibly another copayment).  We document the decisions we make together in a thoroughly detailed manner, often in the presence of the patient, which takes some time but improves the quality of care and communication.  We also care for our own patients in the hospital, which makes care in the hospital more safe, comfortable, and efficient. (This also means that the first patient in the office on a given day is probably not the first patient of the day overall.)  Whenever possible, we address routine screening and wellness concerns at each visit, so the patient does not have to wait until the annual “wellness” or “physical” visit to receive that care; whenever appropriate, depending on the medical situation, we may perform that service on the same day as a visit for specific medical problems, to save the patient some time; the total cost to the patient is the same, and in some cases the total reimbursement to the practice is less, but most importantly the patient doesn’t have to make an extra trip to the office.  We acknowledge that life is full of trade-offs, and some of the ones we choose to make at our practice have occasionally resulted in wait times longer than we would like.  We are continuously working to improve that, and we are absolutely confident that we will as our systems and workflows improve, but the truth is that the vast majority of our patients believe that it has been worth it, and we would agree with them.  We have tremendous respect for our patients, their time, and their concerns, and we are proud to provide medical care in a way that we are confident reflects that respect - even if it’s necessary to wait at times to experience it.  We consider it a privilege to care for you as our patient and hope to see you again soon.

name: David Gaither
text: My wife went to a wellness evaluation with dr. Green. During this visit she told him of problems she was having and he prescribed medicine and told her of some labs he wanted her to take. We called our insurance and verified these labs were ok. Later after the labs we get a bill for $550. Two labs on this bill that were not covered were never discussed with my wife and she did not know she was having them done. I called the dr. Office and his nurse said the dr. Added these labs and she said they have been having problems with insurance companies not covering them. I asked her why the dr. Did not discuss this with my wife first and the only thing she told me was that the cdc recommends them. Well the CDC is not my insurance company. I called my insurance and asked what was the problem. They told me that the dr sent them the wrong codes. That he sent routine codes instead of diagnostic codes. They called him and asked for the diagnostic codes and he refused to give them the codes saying there were no other codes that can be given. Well I think the insurance company would know if there were no other codes or not. Anyway I called the dr. And asked them why would they knowingly have my wife take labs, they did not discuss with her first, knowing our insurance probably would not pay for if it is only routine and not for a diagnostic purpose. I still have no answer and a big bill for something my wife neither needed or was told he was doing.I DONT TRUST THESE PEOPLE, I CANNOT TRUST dR. gREEN TO DO WHAT IS MEDICALLY AND MORALLY BEST FOR ME AND WIFE.

resp.text: Sir, We are sorry that you are so upset. We are generally meticulous about discussing each diagnostic test that we order with each patient, and the reason for doing so. That's important, in part, for this very reason - we can never know with complete certainty what an insurance company may or may not cover. And, of course, our medical decisions are made, first and foremost, with the good of the patient in mind; whether the insurance company decides to cover them, while important, is a secondary consideration. Medical decisions are made between the patient and the doctor, and no one should come in between that sacred bond. There are various different reasons that a test might be felt to be indicated - sometimes to evaluate an active problem, and other times to screen for a potential problem - and the tests and treatments we select are generally chosen according to scientific evidence and/or according to the clinical guidelines that define the standard of medical care in our country. The "codes" are used to communicate the reasons for tests to the insurance company; sometimes there is more than one code that could be used for a given test for a given patient (because there may be several reasons a test is ordered at a certain point in time), and other times there is really only one code that is appropriate. Some tests the insurance company may decide that they will never cover, and others they may cover only for certain reasons (which can change without notice). If they choose not to cover a test, it's usually not so much because the "wrong" code was sent, but rather because they have chosen not to cover that test for the reason it was ordered. If we can ever provide them other reasons, or codes, that weren't submitted at first because the first set of reasons sent seemed to the doctor to be an adequate explanation, then we will send those additional codes. But sometimes, all of the reasons we supply just aren't enough to get the insurance company to cover the test. Sometimes there are other codes that might get them to cover the test, but these aren't really the "right" codes unless they actually apply to the reasons the test was ordered for that patient at that time. We understand you are upset, and we understand why. But we would respectfully suggest that your concerns about lack of coverage are better directed to your medical insurance plan, which may have a different idea of "medical necessity" than your doctor, and we would further respectfully suggest that you consider that your doctor is the one that defines medical necessity, and that while the doctor has nothing to gain from ordering more tests, the insurance company could potentially have something to gain from declining to pay for some tests. We stand behind the reasons we order all of the tests we order, and the reasons are quite thoroughly documented in each patient's medical record, and we refuse to let another entity dictate to us what is appropriate for our patients.  We strive to review all the tests ordered and their reasons, but there is a lot that goes on during medical appointments, particularly ones that are conducted in-depth as ours are, and while we also work to ensure that the patient understands very well the plan of care, it's quite a lot to ask the patient to also remember every last test ordered and the exact reason why. While it would be great if the patient could remember all of that, that's really more the job of the doctor to take care of that in the medical record. If we failed to mention a test and the reason for it, we certainly wish to apologize. We would just ask you to consider the possibility that all of the tests ordered may have been discussed with your wife, and perhaps she was understandably more focused on the problem that was bothering her than on all of the screening tests that were also being ordered as part of a comprehensive visit. We consider it a privilege to care for our patients and will do whatever we can to be of service.

name: David Hattaway
text: Dr. Green is very dedicated to his patients and takes time to explain your visit. He is very thorough and kind in his approach. I would highly recommend Dr. Green to anyone looking for a Doctor who honestly is compassionate about patient care.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, David.

name: david pepper
text: I was pleasantly surprised as it's always a bit scary taking on a new Dr. Dr. Green is very thorough and quite easy to deal with, I'm looking forward to a long relationship with him in his practice and highly recommend him to others.

resp.text: We really value getting to know our patients, and look forward to long relationships with them, too, David.  Thanks for sharing your kind words.

name: DJ McCurdy
text: I see and trust Dr. Brock.  Everyone I interact with is professional and courteous. People need to realize that not all are associated with CVA. There are a number of people that work for the hospital.  However I have found them to be as pleasant and helpful as anyone as well. Overall I look forward to going.  My wife is also a patient there so we get twice the opportunity for issues. We both rate the  whole building a 5.

name: anna cash
text: Rushed appointment. I wasn't able to get an echo or blood work because everyone was gone! The nurse wrote my information on a scrap sheet of paper & didn't chart any of it because the nurse that called me a month later was completely lost. My follow up was a phone call to read the results of my heart monitor and I was charged $200! Good luck contacting a nurse or Dr if needed!

name: Amy L
text: Visit from start to finish took 2.5 hours but about 2 of those hours were spent in the waiting room. From the moment I entered, the lady at the front did not look like she wanted to be there. The dr also did not seem happy either. The explanations were not clear on directions of where to go next and why tests were needed. The most concerning part of the visit was when the phlebotomist touched his ungloved hand on my disinfected arm before drawing blood. The visit overall gave me a lot of anxiety, and I did not feel cared for.

name: Beverly Lang
text: Great place with lots of on-site testing. Also, some of the best and nicest doctors and nurses around.

name: Jacqueline Moore
text: My husband had a stent procedure March 24th. After coming home the next day, he was having some discomfort. He called the CVA office ( off of 280: Colonnade Parkway) 3/26 around 10:20 a.m. He asked the receptionist to have Dr. Sample’s nurse to call him. His wrist ( which was the first place they tried to place his stent) was in pain and a knot had come up on his wrist. The nurse never called that day. He called again Tuesday, 3/30. After several tries, he finally talked to the nurse. Today, 4/2, he called and asked the receptionist to have the nurse to call him because his legs were cramping. He is concerned that he is having a reaction to the medicine that Dr. Sample prescribed. No nurse called him back today. The receptionist told him that it may take 48 hours for someone (nurse or doctor) to call him back. What does the patient do in this situation? It seems that CVA is not able to take of the patients after perform a procedure on them. We need advice and help from management from this facility. Overall, the main problem is getting a nurse to call my husband to help him.

name: Alan Creighton
text: Dr. Eagan has taken great care of my mother and father over the last ten years.  His knowledge and professionalism has been excellent.  He listens, is considerate, answers our questions and guides us as we make decisions regarding our health care.  I highly recommend him.

name: Susan Bowen
text: Usually visits are well organized with great heart doctors. Today they were OFF!  Wear mask in the building, ok that’s fine!  By the time we left, no one at desk to check us out, they had gone home. Thank goodness for the sweet custodial lady who found someone to help us.  Go to ask a clinical tech, a question pull my mask down, hatefully she says, PUT THAT MASK ON NOW!!!  OK, I also tell her as I walk off I don’t have the Corona.  She’s worried about me standing 6 feet away , asking 1 question. When you stop for temp check, they put O2 meter on your finger, but not ONCE DID THEY CLEAN IT,between the patients that came in after me.   Glad I went to bathroom and washed my hands after we were checked in.  But has excellent doctors!

name: Shelley Roman
text: I had the worst service here with my mother. She was seeing Dr. Hasabnis and he basically scolded us saying she doesn’t need a heart specialist. She just needs a primary care doctor even though we got a referral. He was completely rude and had no bedside manners. I work with many doctors and have never been in such an uncomfortable situation. He is what is wrong with medical care and why many people are afraid to see the doctor. I am very disappointed in his attitude and unprofessional demeanor.

name: Randy Thompson
text: Can't get results back in a timely manner. Nobody will answer phone when you call in. I was on hold 28 minutes. I plan to change Cardiologists in the near future. This place went down hill fast after Dr. Larry Dye and Kathy Black left...

name: Patrick Hubbard
